The question of onomatopoeia is near orthogonal to the question of relatedness:  

scratch is clearly onomatopoetic, yet it clearly belongs to the strong PIE root *(s)ker â€œto cutâ€ â‡” scrape [script](script.html) â€¦  

There are hundreds of plausibile sounds connected to entities. If the whole planet uses different sounds to describe an object and (as an example) two neigboring languages use â€œpopâ€ there is a high chance that these two â€œpopâ€ are related, onomatopoetic or not.  

In general the author ascribes low relevance to onomatopoeia when multiple onomatopoeial forms exist and similar forms are locally clustered  
However in case of bird names ğ“…š ğ“…™ and other animals, special care is appropriate  

quieck pig poink â‡” pink  
quack duck?  
wolf (whoul.[fair](fair))
